long: Meaning: to "fill" or (intransitively) "be full of", in a wide application (literally and figuratively).  Usage: accomplish, confirm,   consecrate, be at an end, be expired, be fenced, fill, fulfil, (be, become, × draw, give in, go) full(-ly, -ly set, tale), (over-) flow, fulness, furnish, gather (selves, together), presume, replenish, satisfy, set, space, take a (hand-) full,   have wholly.  Source: or "מָלָא"; (Esther 7:5), a primitive root;
